column4: I'm trying to set UserDir in my apache2.conf, but keep getting the error "Invalid command".  Can anyone help me figure out why?
when do you recieve that error?
did you enable the module needed for userdir?
are you following a guide or just going off the comments in the config file?
a2enmod is a command implemented in debian based distros, it enables modules in apache so you do not have to manually link them
the && means run this next command only after the first has finished, and the 2nd command restarts apache
Oh, ok so do I put in the literal 'user_dir' or should I substiiitute that with something
user_dir is the correct name of the module that you need to enable
hm, apparently the module doesn't exist
run a2enmod without specifying a module, this will give a list of available modules
also, it appears that this user encountered the same problem and was able to get it resolved: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=143350
it looks like the module was just "userdir"
good, is it working for you?
I'm getting permission issues, but I'll see if I can fix that
or if you are referrring to the webserver, check .htaccess
